Justice.prompt: It’s time for the end of white supremacy - for Black, Indigenous, and People Of Color (BIPOC)  liberation, reparations, and collective evolution.

self.choice: Make a post on social media to share your support.

society.choice: Organize to achieve land back and reparations through social, cultural, economic and political movements.

sustainability.choice: Prioritize the most affected communities by sending a continuous donation to services with low funding.

Equity.prompt: Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPOC) communities are still fighting for their rights to control their own destiny and achieve equity.

self.choice: Make sure you can vote freely to make your voice heard.

society.choice: Support movements to pass bills to protect voting rights by calling your representatives or protesting.

sustainability.choice: Make sure impacted communities can control their own lives and environment through treaties, representation, and equal legal protections rooted in historic understanding.

Health.prompt: Honor your breath, the breath of all people, and the air itself as a way to center in health.

self.choice: Take 5 minutes to deeply breathe some fresh air (meditate).

society.choice: Learn CPR to help people breathe.

sustainability.choice: Read and communicate the Green New Deal and other visions for a just transition to a regenerative economy - so we can all breathe a sigh of relief in clean air.

Health.prompt: Take steps to protect yourself, others, and the natural world.

self.choice: Get your coronavirus vaccine if safe for you.

society.choice: Call your members of Congress to advocate for Medicare For All.

sustainability.choice: Prevent further encroachment into wild places to protect environmental health.

Education.prompt: The American education system has many great qualities or intentions; it also has a lot of room to grow as a vehicle and key piece of reparations.

self.choice: Read The 1619 Project to educate yourself on the consequences of slavery and the contributions of Black Americans

society.choice: Organize a School Strike for Equity in funding and representation.

sustainability.choice: Run for school board on a Reparations platform.

Housing.prompt: We believe housing is a human right so everyone should have a home, and a sustainable world where everyone can live in harmony with the Earth.

self.choice: Live in an affordable, comfortable home where you don’t worry about paying the bills - sanctuary.

society.choice: Support universal green housing efforts with transit connected, walkable communities through localized advocacy in your community through the Green New Deal Network.

sustainability.choice: Promote a Global Green New Deal - green public housing at the national and global level.

Food.prompt: Repair our bodies and our relationships to the Earth by growing and sharing food while honoring the land and water in which it grows.

self.choice: Take care of your body, all people, and the Earth by eating more plant-based meals.

society.choice: Advocate with your members of Congress for food stamps in the US and nutrition for all globally so everyone can get what they need to survive and thrive.

sustainability.choice: Support small farmers to employ sustainable farming practices and localize food supplies,  in large-scale agribusiness.

Community.prompt: We can take responsibility for our own parts of the world on a local level. Think global, and act local!

self.choice: Get to know your neighborhood while getting exercise by walking/biking to work and errands

society.choice: Organize community meetings to listen to neighbors’ needs and concerns.

sustainability.choice: Developing a Green Benefit District plan for your neighborhood.

Work.prompt: Work can and should be a place for liberation, balance, and positive change.  It’s one way we contribute to society and a sustainable future.

self.choice: If you feel like you are overly responsible, make space for and follow new leadership, and kick back to rest and totally let go of the day.

society.choice: Accept a position of leadership in your democratic Labor Union.

sustainability.choice: Establish zero waste guidelines for your workplace.

Energy.prompt: We have to invest time, energy and money into universal access to a clean, sustainable power grid.

self.choice: Put up a clothes line for the ultimate solar clothes dryer.

society.choice: Start a clean power utility in your community.

sustainability.choice: Introduce a solar feed-in tariff for farmers to become sustainable and generate a secondary income.

Mutual Aid.prompt: People should come together as a community to support each other directly with resources and services to fulfill needs and address systemic problems.

self.choice: Look up an online how-to video to repair a broken object or appliance

society.choice: Establish a Fix-it Clinic in your area

sustainability.choice: Implement a right-to-repair policy so we can make planned obsolescence obsolete.

Mutual Aid.prompt: Mutual aid (people coming together as communities to support each other directly with resources and services) is gaining ground as a concept and tactic for fulfilling needs and addressing systemic problems.

self.choice: Provide a Skill Share session as a “Public Amateur”

society.choice: Organize a weekend Skill Share event with fellow "Public Amateurs"

Mutual Aid.sustainability: Build and maintain a community garden

Just Migration.prompt: It is critical that wealthy consumer nations welcome those who have been displaced from their homes due to inequities.

self.choice: Read poetry or watch videos about migration struggles and solidarity.

society.choice: Advocate for migrants rights and services, by lobbying, protesting, civil disobedience, or direct service.

sustainability.choice: Help ensure migrants are some of the first to benefit from clean energy and practices.

Nature.prompt: Nature in all its forms has the right to exist, persist, maintain, and regenerate its vital cycles.

self.choice: Chill out under your favorite tree and observe seasonal changes

society.choice: Lobby local officials with the power to grant or deny permits to loggers.

sustainability.choice: Invest and transition the logger workers to tree farmers and eco-restoration workers.

Nature.prompt: Nature in all its forms has the right to exist, persist, maintain, and regenerate its vital cycles.

self.choice: Observe the cycle of the moon outside, from a window, or on an app ( ie. Sky Safari, Star Walk, Star Chart, Night Sky Pro, Pocket Universe)

society.choice: Observe bird behavior of individual birds, species, and interspecies  -- with other bird lovers if possible

sustainability.choice: Research the wisdom of the ancestors about how humans are connected to Earth and all her systems.

Recreation.prompt: All living things experience cycles of energy.  Humans need rest and play, just as nature relies on the seasons for rejuvenation.

self.choice: Improve your musical skills by practicing on an instrument.

society.choice: Advocate for budgeting for public arts programs where we can collectively create and celebrate.

sustainability.choice: Ensure vacations and recreation are sustainable by lobbying for investment in bullet train systems and plastic alternative laws.

Environment.prompt: People, animals and plants are both part of and dependent upon an overall structure that provides the conditions and resources needed for survival.

self.choice: Clean your space and adopt some plants for a restful home.

society.choice: Ensure public green space is built, protected, rehabilitated, and maintained.

sustainability.choice: Clean up the oceans as an eco-tourist activity people are subsidized to do.

Decolonization.prompt: Systems created in colonized lands are based on the privilege and worldview of the oppressor.  The hierarchy they established is the basis of inequity.

self.choice: Pay a Land Tax to local Indigenous people

society.choice: Help fund and promote a Land Trust for local Indigenous people

sustainability.choice: Promote adoption of traditional ecological knowledge (TEK) on all Public Lands

Storytelling.prompt: Humans have always learned about the world through stories shared, so we must know those that reflect the truth of our full diversity.

self.choice: Imagine “being in another person’s shoes” to understand their perspective and how they might feel.

society.choice: Participate in a community storytelling project. Share your story and listen to others.

sustainability.choice: Attend your neighborhood Environmental Justice film festival.

Transport.prompt: Transportation generates the largest share of greenhouse gases.  Everyone is dependent on it, so clean and equitable methods must be accessible to all.

self.choice: Make sure you can easily move around by living close to public transportation in a safe, walkable, bikeable city.

society.choice: Consider a career in public transportation planning, construction, maintenance, or operation to help people use comfortable, fast, reliable, accessible bullet trains in smart green cities.

sustainability.choice: Help facilitate the just transition of workers and communities to clean transportation that is convenient and serves everyone equally.

Transport.prompt: Transportation generates the largest share of greenhouse gases.  Everyone is dependent on it, so clean and equitable methods must be accessible to all.

self.choice: Fix up your old bike that’s been collecting dust in the garage.

society.choice: Lobby your local city council to turn a 60s era urban freeway into a people-first boulevard.

sustainability.choice: Replace your city’s diesel bus fleet with electric buses with dedicated lane service.

Arts.prompt: Human creativity and expression are a source of joy, recreation, appreciation of beauty, social commentary, and ingenuity.

self.choice: Create an arts and crafts project using eco-friendly materials.

society.choice: Contribute to a student made video game that communicates the Green New Deal and its benefits to society.

sustainability.choice: Lobby officials to maintain public arts budget for youth in low-income areas and schools.

Resources.prompt: Fixing and reusing may take time, but it saves on energy and resources that come with dismantling and remanufacturing.

self.choice: Mend the small hole in your favorite socks — a stitch in time saves 9!

society.choice: Volunteer to help fix the gate at your local school.

sustainability.choice: Participate in a wetlands restoration project in your county.

Truth.prompt: Tell the truth. Demand the truth.  Strive to understand the truth.

self.choice: Learn about white privilege, supremacy, and American exceptionalism and the harm it’s caused.

society.choice: Organize an event where people share their stories, tactics, etc about overcoming oppression.

sustainability.choice: Integrate a truth and reconciliation process centered in schools to learn the truth and make reparations for climate justice.

self.choice: Join a 12-month group meditation practice following Stephen Levine’s “A Year to Live”

society.choice: Join a Threshold Choir to help families and the dying through the passing

sustainability.choice: Promote laws and ordinances for low-resource burial or cremation
